intro: Ochrosia mariannensis var. crassicarpa, commonly known as the thick-fruited ochrosia, is a tropical shrub native to the island of Guam. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces fleshy, berry-like fruits that are typically orange-red in color. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, subtropical climate of its native habitat. Ochrosia mariannensis var. crassicarpa is often found in dry to moist forest environments and is of interest for its ornamental value and ecological significance.
